alert.note: Alert for Baraga; Houghton (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 15 at 7:47AM EDT until April 19 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Michigan... Sturgeon River near Alston affecting Baraga and Houghton Counties. Middle Branch Escanaba River at Humboldt affecting Marquette County. East Branch Escanaba River at Gwinn affecting Marquette County. Black River near Bessemer affecting Gogebic County. .Warm temperatures and snow melt will cause the river flows to become high. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sturgeon River near Alston. * WHEN...Until Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Additional homes and structures near the river are impacted and evacuations may be necessary. Water levels may reach the bottom of Froberg bridge in addition to other bridges that cross the river * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 AM EDT Saturday the stage was 9.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:30 AM EDT Saturday was 9.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.1 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.0 feet on 09/14/1980. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 1100 PM EDT /1000 PM CDT/.
